Object_Definition: CREATE FUNCTION [dbo].[ScheduleDescription] (     @freq_type INT,     @freq_interval INT,     @freq_subday_type INT,     @freq_subday_interval INT,     @freq_relative_interval INT,     @freq_recurrence_factor INT,     @active_start_time INT ) RETURNS NVARCHAR(MAX) AS BEGIN     DECLARE @Description NVARCHAR(MAX) = N'';     DECLARE @TimePart NVARCHAR(20);     DECLARE @StartTimeFormatted TIME = CONVERT(TIME, STUFF(STUFF(RIGHT('000000' + CAST(@active_start_time AS VARCHAR(6)), 6), 3, 0, ':'), 6, 0, ':'));     SET @TimePart = N' at ' + CONVERT(NVARCHAR(8), @StartTimeFormatted, 108);      IF @freq_type = 1         SET @Description = N'Runs once' + @TimePart + N'.';     ELSE IF @freq_type = 4 -- Daily     BEGIN         IF @freq_subday_type = 1         BEGIN             IF @freq_interval = 1                 SET @Description = N'Runs daily' + @TimePart + N'.';             ELSE                 SET @Description = N'Runs every ' + CAST(@freq_interval AS NVARCHAR(10)) + N' days' + @TimePart + N'.';         END         ELSE         BEGIN             DECLARE @subdayUnit NVARCHAR(20) =                 CASE @freq_subday_type                     WHEN 2 THEN N'second(s)'                     WHEN 4 THEN N'minute(s)'                     WHEN 8 THEN N'hour(s)'                     ELSE N''                 END;             SET @Description = N'Runs every ' + CAST(@freq_subday_interval AS NVARCHAR(10)) + N' ' + @subdayUnit + N' each day starting' + @TimePart + N'.';         END     END     ELSE IF @freq_type = 8 -- Weekly     BEGIN         DECLARE @DaysOfWeek NVARCHAR(100) = N'';         SET @DaysOfWeek =             STUFF(                 CASE WHEN @freq_interval & 1 = 1 THEN ', Sunday' ELSE '' END +                 CASE WHEN @freq_interval & 2 = 2 THEN ', Monday' ELSE '' END +                 CASE WHEN @freq_interval & 4 = 4 THEN ', Tuesday' ELSE '' END +                 CASE WHEN @freq_interval & 8 = 8 THEN ', Wednesday' ELSE '' END +                 CASE WHEN @freq_interval & 16 = 16 THEN ', Thursday' ELSE '' END +                 CASE WHEN @freq_interval & 32 = 32 THEN ', Friday' ELSE '' END +                 CASE WHEN @freq_interval & 64 = 64 THEN ', Saturday' ELSE '' END +                 CASE WHEN @freq_interval = 8 THEN ', Every day' ELSE '' END +                 CASE WHEN @freq_interval = 9 THEN ', Weekdays (Mon-Fri)' ELSE '' END +                 CASE WHEN @freq_interval = 10 THEN ', Weekend (Sat-Sun)' ELSE '' END             , 1, 2, '');          SET @Description = N'Runs ' +             CASE WHEN @freq_recurrence_factor = 1 THEN N'weekly' ELSE N'every ' + CAST(@freq_recurrence_factor AS NVARCHAR(10)) + N' weeks' END +             N' on ' + @DaysOfWeek + @TimePart + N'.';     END     ELSE IF @freq_type = 16 -- Monthly, specific day     BEGIN         SET @Description = N'Runs ' +             CASE WHEN @freq_recurrence_factor = 1 THEN N'monthly' ELSE N'every ' + CAST(@freq_recurrence_factor AS NVARCHAR(10)) + N' months' END +             N' on day ' + CAST(@freq_interval AS NVARCHAR(10)) + @TimePart + N'.';     END     ELSE IF @freq_type = 32 -- Monthly, relative     BEGIN         DECLARE @RelativeIntervalName NVARCHAR(20) =             CASE @freq_relative_interval                 WHEN 1 THEN N'first'                 WHEN 2 THEN N'second'                 WHEN 4 THEN N'third'                 WHEN 8 THEN N'fourth'                 WHEN 16 THEN N'last'                 ELSE N'?'             END;         DECLARE @DayOfWeekName NVARCHAR(20) =             CASE @freq_interval                 WHEN 1 THEN N'Sunday' WHEN 2 THEN N'Monday' WHEN 3 THEN N'Tuesday'                 WHEN 4 THEN N'Wednesday' WHEN 5 THEN N'Thursday' WHEN 6 THEN N'Friday'                 WHEN 7 THEN N'Saturday' WHEN 8 THEN N'day'                 WHEN 9 THEN N'weekday' WHEN 10 THEN N'weekend day'                 ELSE N'?'             END;          SET @Description = N'Runs ' +             CASE WHEN @freq_recurrence_factor = 1 THEN N'monthly' ELSE N'every ' + CAST(@freq_recurrence_factor AS NVARCHAR(10)) + N' months' END +             N' on the ' + @RelativeIntervalName + N' ' + @DayOfWeekName + @TimePart + N'.';     END     ELSE IF @freq_type = 64         SET @Description = N'Runs when SQL Server Agent starts.';     ELSE IF @freq_type = 128         SET @Description = N'Runs when the CPU is idle.';     ELSE         SET @Description = N'Unknown schedule.';      RETURN @Description; END;
Metadata: PARAMETERS: ( nvarchar OUT, @freq_type int, @freq_interval int, @freq_subday_type int, @freq_subday_interval int, @freq_relative_interval int, @freq_recurrence_factor int, @active_start_time int)
COLUMNS: (job_id ASC)
COLUMNS: (job_id ASC)
